ygData.subject: OT: LOTR movie (was:RE: [eqbards] Dark Age of Camelot)
ygData.msgSnippet: Personally I think Sean Bean would have made a better Aragorn then Boromir. I do not feel he has the physique to pull it off.  He is one of my favorite actors
ygData.messageBody:
Personally I think Sean Bean would have made a better Aragorn then Boromir.
I do not feel he has the physique to pull it off. He is one of my favorite
actors though and I am glad he is in it. I am looking forward to these
three movies and I really, really hope they do not suck :)

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Friday, November 17, 2000 9:36 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Dark Age of Camelot
>
>
> Yikes! I thought the animated version was ok, but certainly
> not of that
> caliber. Gandalf is being played by Sir Ian McKellen
> (Magneto from X-Men),
> Liv Tyler plays Arwen, Sean Bean (Sharpe of the Sharpe's series) plays
> Boromir, Elijah Wood plays Frodo, Samwise is played by the Sean Astin
> (Rudy), Saruman is played by Christopher Lee, Bilbo by Ian
> Holm, Gimli by
> John Rys-Davies, Galadriel by Cate Blanchett, Wormtongue by
> Brad Dourif.
> The cast alone makes this an immense undertaking. Throw in
> the fact that it
> will be three movies, one for each book in the trilogy and I
> think it will
> be very exciting. more info available at
> http://www.tolkienonline.com/
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Legba Work [mailto:mattdeba@...]
> Sent: Friday, November 17, 2000 10:15 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Dark Age of Camelot
>
>
> It doesn't matter, it would be like so one remaking the white
> album, (or
> redoing Psycho, say...)
>
> I found the animated movie to be nearly perfect (I really love it that
> much). Computer generated monsters will never be as scary as the Ring
> Wraiths were. What are the chances whoever is playing
> Gandalf (anyone have
> a cast list yet) is as much of a bastard as he was in the
> animated version?
> And somehow I can't see being Mini Me (I forgot his real
> name) being as
> appealing as Pippen was...
>
> We'll see and again I hope I'm wrong :-)
>
>
>
